text: Best sandwich shop!!! Since I was a child my mom has taken me here for good comfort food. And I have never been disappointed. And now as a mother I take my son here who feels the same way. Great Chicago landmark restaurant

This place has comfort food and damn good comfort food at that. I've been once for breakfast and it was the largest, richest, unhealthiest breakfast I've ever had, but it was DELICIOUS!  My fiancé and I ordered the Jumpball All Day and split it and it was more than enough food to fill up both of us. With Italian sausage, eggs, cheese, onions & potatoes, it's every desirable breakfast item all in one!  This place is small, crowded, loud and bustling (Hint: Not an ideal place for an intimate first date). Our meal took about 40 minutes to come out because it was so crowded on a Sunday morning, but it was worth it!

This place used to be good. The last three deliveries I had from them they messed up my order. This last time was the worst. I called to let them know that they forgot a hamburger and the lady kept yelling at me that she didn't charge me for it. Like that was going to make it all better. She was so rude, left me on hold and told me that she would charge a delivery fee for one hamburger and it would take a half hour. I only have a half hour lunch break. I will never order from here again.

This is, hand's down, the best sandwich shop in the area, perhaps all of Chicago. They open for breakfast before anyone else and their "Corned Beef Jumpball", made with grilled onions, cubed potatoes, and corned beef, is unbelievable. I actually drive to Chicago to get this Jumpball. You have to ask for it because it is not on the menu, but their regular Jumpball is just as good and made with Italian Sausage, 3 eggs, cheese, onions and potatoes. BJ runs it and he was a Chicago Cop who walked this beat before picking up Moon's, which has continually been in business since 1933. The people watching is as good as the sandwiches, especially in the morning when you get a lot of night workers coming off their shifts. The place is a mixing pot of cultures and values and races all brought together at the counter of Moon's to share a sandwich. I love this place!
A killer corndbeef sandwich very good chili with the best water, I grew up across the street , never had a bad meal there.
Food was good. Sandwich was a little cool on delivery, wrong soda (requested A&W, got Dr. Pepper). I may order from them again...Just hard to order $15 worth of food/drink for lunch...

The food was ok. The corn beef i guess is supposed to be 1 of the highlight it wasn't bad a kind of diner. Lets just say i wouldn't  drive out of my way for it. 1 thing i notice is why they get good reviews is they definitely treat there locals different a lot better...
Fast Delivery, Phat sandwiches, and tasty!!
One of the most ghettoest places you could ever go out to eat. The staff there is horrible a bunch of THOTS.  The food is full of grease and is unhealthy for you
Great Corn Beef sandwich.  They give you a lot of meat, and USUALLY quick service despite being very busy.  Breakfast is good too.
Great corn beef put pricey breakfast reasonable and good just tell them to not cover your bacon in foil makes it soft on deliveries

Ordered delivery from here via Eat24. Food arrived on time, was perfectly wrapped and tidy - no spillage - and best of all, delicious food at a reasonable price. I was particularly impressed with the cheeseburger. It was classic, delicious, juicy and really hit the spot. The corn beef sandwich was ridiculously, impressively large. Pickles were fabulous. All the ingredients tasted really fresh. Glad that they open early. I will definitely be ordering from here again.
My guy loves there corn beef sandwhich. He gets this happy dance. He truly loves this place.

I went to Moon's for the infamous corned beef sandwich at lunch time. It appeared to be the quintessential "greasy spoon".  They were very busy but orders were delivered expeditiously. The service was very good and everyone was very friendly. I'd love to go back to try the breakfast. The sandwich was huge and I actually got about 3 meals from it. It was good although I prefer to have my corned beef sandwiches grilled so the bread is buttery and crunchy.  I'm not sure I'd get the corned beef again but it was the most generous sandwich I've ever had. $11 was a huge sandwich,  chips and a soda.

I've heard about this place and the corned beef sandwiches from people like my dad. It's got weird hours, but I decided to give out a try when I saw it was open.  *Disclaimer* (Don't order the corn beef dinner, it is essentially a "build it yourself" plate that they give you.) I got the dinner, tuna salad sandwich and a british burger for later. The burger was good, the tuna salad pretty meh even though they pack it pretty thick.  Right off the bat the dinner disappointed me, the sandwich wasn't premade, everything was put into a standard lunch tray with two pieces of bread on top. The gravy from the potatoes got in EVERYTHING! The beef was cooked perfectly, but everything else in the dinner (corn, salad, potatoes) were average. Overall I'd try this place again if I can get the actual sandwich.
Really great corned beef sandwich, wish I got two. The potatoes were a great side as well. Got our food quickly and hostess was kind & funny.

Had them delivered at work yesterday for breakfast and lunch. All was good. Corned beef sandwiches is off the chain good and I live a few blocks away from an AP deli. Doesn't even compare anymore. Breakfast was a huge healthy portion. On my way over there today!

I don't want you to know about this place, so I'm going to lie through my teeth and tell you it sucks.  :o)   You don't believe me?  Okay.  I wouldn't either.  It's actually amazing.  Hearty portions.  Fair prices.  As old school as old school gets.  Busy counter.  Eat in once in awhile instead of doing the grab-and-go!  Good folks here.

I went here once for breakfast.   Everything was as it should be:  coffee hot and fresh, half and half, bacon crisp, toast with butter melting on it.  The potatoes needed salt but that's easy to do.  I watched the cook prepping some in-house corned beef and it looked really good.  I'll have to go back for lunch now.

Everything about this gigantic corned beef sandwich was amazing.  The corned beef was flavorful and tender.  The pickles were fresh and crispy and the rye bread complimented the sandwich so well. I do not normally care for rye bread but wanted to order the sandwich the way they make it.  There rye bread meshed with the sandwich really well and I did not get overwhelmed by the flavor in the bread.  They also give you a small plate of corned beef for free when you arrive. The restaurant itself was very buisy.  It was a bit shabby but dont let that scare you the food  is worth staying. The customer service was great and I found the employees and even customers around me to be very friendly.

A friend recently brought home an extra corned beef sandwich- it was great, and hooked me into trying this place dining in (especially after reading the reviews). It was delicious thin sliced corned beef with lettuce, pickle, tomato, and mustard. Old school yes, but classic too- and that never goes out of style! I want to make it in there and try the mac & cheese and other high cholesterol food.  I hadn't realized how close I was to it until (after trying the corned beef,) I was shopping at the Pete's Fresh Market grocers across the street. The exterior is old school too, which caught my eye. One of the things that irks me about living in the city is that there are so often changes that  sweep aside the classic elements that brought an area character in the first place. But this place doesn't seem like it's going anywhere, and I'm thankful for that!

Old school... This reminded me what those sandwich shops were like back in the 1930s, etc that my great grandpa always talks about  Place was packed It typical lunch counter cafe food  Fun experience tho, the breakfast special was large portion and cheap

OK OK!! ....I had to visit Moon's and try this fabulous corned beef sandwich I've heard about and seen on  yelp.com .  I have to report it is as fabulous as those experienced Yelp posters claim it is.  The corned beef is lean and tasty, very comparable to other delis where one would expect to pay much more for a same quality corned beef sandwich.  Moon's piles on the corned beef without skimping that is for sure.  A thin bread of your choice, rye was mine along with crisp lettuce, chips and a drink for under 10 bucks.  A bargain! However, Moon's might be a culture shock for those that live east of Western Ave. as the affluent meet their poorer cousins and fall in love over a great sandwich.  Moon's is in dire need of a top to bottom clean up without destroying any of the 1940's paneling or decor.  This place borders on the historic and needs to be preserved. Moon's corned beef is exceptional.  Moon's desperately is in need of a Spring cleaning! Minus one (1) star for lack of complete cleanliness.  ****

I'm from Chicago, so I may be a little partial to the old school establishments. Getting my order was taken a little hectic, the lady was taking orders, expiditing, verifying with the cooks and getting orders out to the customers...  Didn't bother me though. The corned beef was sliced thin like I like,  the rye bread could've been a thicker slice and maybe a little more grain

Had a late breakfast at MOONS. ordered a ham & cheese omelet with fried potatoes and raisin toast.  The omelet was Bursting with American cheese and the ham off the bone was salty in a great way! The potatoes were great and i added onions and peppers with that. The raisin toast was slathered with real butter. My partner had the corned beef sandwich that can easily beat  AP Deli and Manny's Deli it comes with a tiny bag of chip and a can of soda. The corned beef was freshly cut and the juices were bursting off the meat. Now the drawback: The place is a dive and needs a good sandblasting wash. The employees are quick and attentive. Boot leg movie guy still sells movies at a reasonable price.  I do not recommend buying any jewelry from anyone in MOONS because it is FAKE! Free parking on street.  I would hold off on any visit to the washroom you will think you were shipped back in time to the 1950'S. You can phone in order for pick up if you are one of those new DAINTY west siders who live in the overpriced condos near by. I would give MOONS 3 1/2 star on price and just plain west side flavor!
I haven't been here in about 4mos but I was a regular here 2-3 times a week for the cornbeef and the pastrami, breakfast is also an A+, the hashbrown potatoes are very good, one of Chicago's finest!
I love the "Moon's Breakfast" and "Off the griddle." The pancakes are so good. My favorite neighborhood joint.
I love me some Moon's.  The food's always great, though delivery can be a bit wonky since they hand-write everything.  Give them time, your patience will be justly rewarded!

Saw this place as I was driving home from a shift. Just the curbside appeal automatically caught my attention so me and my lady friend decided we had to go in.  Upon entering we were greeted warmly by the staff. Once we sat down the women working the counter gave us the history of the place and told us we had to have the corned beef so we obliged.  While waiting for the sandwiches the place came alive a regular there came in and started giving everyone a hard time. I couldn't keep myself together it was one of the most genuinely entertaining experiences of my life. Eventually I joined in on the fun and much to my surprise my remarks were welcomed. I felt like I was regular already.  The sandwiches came out with my sweet and the ladies lemonade and we knew why this place had been around for so long.  Bottom line: I'll be back as often as possible.

The corned beef sandwich was one that I will not soon forget. Perfectly balanced  flavor on good bread. Very reasonably priced and very good portion. Good place for a quick sandwich. What kind of place I wish I had near home.

Awesome classic old school diner food, but a step up.  You can tell they really care about what they are doing.  The food is really special (especially the pancakes and breakfast sandwiches) and you would never know this from looking at the place from Western Ave.  There is a lot of love and attention to detail and it really shines through....plus it's not too expensive!

For the price and ambience, the breakfast could be better. When I go to a hole-in-the-wall type of place, I excpect the food to be spectacular. It's ok. The service is usually fast. The coffee is not great,  the food is decent, the meat options are your standard fare. I can't speak to the dinners.

Don't be silly - if you get anything besides the corned beef you're CRAZY!  I'm not a big fan of corned beef, in fact - i would say I'm not even a small fan of corned beef.  It is not something I would ever order except when my grandma makes it and I have no choice but to eat it or starve.  HOWEVER - not this corned beef.  Perhaps one of the most melt in your mouth, simple, and perfect sandwiches I've ever had.
Good juicy Corned Beef sandwich!  Quick and friendly service, Just a local eatery and dive but good fresh food coming off the griddle all day long. You can get breakfast all day too! Good prices.

In from California for a trade show and stumbled upon Moon's. We enjoyed it so much we ae there every day for the week. Good food, great value, lots of local flavor in a noisy joint that can't have changed much since the 1930's.

A great example of a "mom and pop" place! It's small, but cozy! The service is great and the food is fantastic! The breakfast options and the popular corned beef is fresh and delicious. The scrambled eggs are fluffy and so are the pancakes. The famous corned beef plate and sandwich is even better than the breakfast, and that is saying a lot.  The waiting service is friendly and attentive. You can also see your food being prepared since the kitchen is right across from the seating area so you know that your food is being prepared right on the spot. The only small negatives doesn't have to do with the food, but more with the location. It is a small place so sometimes finding a space to dine in can be a problem, but nothing a little bit of waiting won't fix. Also, this place is almost always full so the waiting staff might take a minute or two to get to you. But this isn't really the waiting staff's fault and it tells a lot that this place is always full regardless of space. Honestly, if you want a great and cheap mom and pop restaurant to go to in Chicago, this is one of its hidden gems!

Oh my - I thought I yelped Moon's before!   A classic Chicago diner circa 1900's.  The food is cooked in front of you and it's great and inexpensive.  I like going in for breakfast but the corn beef is DELICIOUS.  Great crowd for watching or talking!  Try the jumpball for b-fast, you'll need a nap after!  And don't forget to check out Check Please - Moons was on in 2010.  And if you pop in - tell Jimmy at the register I said HI!!
Placed an order for delivery at 5:50AM...almost two hours later and I still haven't received the food. Absolutely ridiculous.
Been here twice... Love this place... Food good & fresh... A lil small but worth it!!! Always a treat

Brought my family here for breakfast last week and found that the sandwiches were mainly a disappointment, particularly the corned beef hash that Meg tried (it's even circled with a big box on the left side of the menu, so if you are gonna promote the specialties, you better make them right!).  But my vanilla order of pancakes, eggs and sausage was pretty good and you can get a ton of food here for $10.  Atmosphere is key, but so is the wait; it's pretty small and takeout is a bigger deal here than the dine-in experience.  Stick to the breakfast classics and make sure to get the sausage, which one server claimed is made specially for Moon's (or in-house), and was the best thing we tried.

Small place but the food was great and the service was excellent! I had the moon special which included pancakes, eggs, choice of meat and I added hash browns. Pancakes were really good. One of the servers gave us a small plate of corned beef to try since he heard us talking about how many sandwiches he was making. It was really good and I normally don't like corned beef. Next time will order a corned beef sandwich.
Ordered delivery yesterday.  Food came hot and delicious as always. Chili mac is a hearty meal, as well.
Corned beef is fresh, juicy and delicious. The people are friendly and it has a great community atmosphere.

ordered from bed this morning...boyfriend went downstairs and picked up the goods..YUM prices are very modest AND the winning part was that tomatoes are an option on their breakfast sandwiches for free!!!!!!!!!
Great fat sandwich for a pretty penny, $10. Hope u think so as well. Although the ambience is not.
Best breakfast place in Chicago.  Their signature dish, the corn beef sandwich is a bit too much for me.   Old diner atmosphere, open since the 1930s.
I have been going here for over 20 years, one of the best Corn Beef Sandwiches in Chicago!!!

OH my belly is so full! I ordered from Moon's this morning and I am currently in food coma on my couch writing this review! I woke up this morning and decided I don't want to cook at all under any circumstances. My house is clean and I'm not fucking that up by cooking myself breakfast. So I hit up Grubhub for a breakfast delivery place and Moon's was the only place that was open and willing to deliver.  First, I am impressed by how quickly they got here. Given that it was pretty early and unlikely that many people were ordering delivery, it was still pretty impressive. The food was piping hot and the delivery girl was very friendly.  I ordered the Jumpball and Three French Toast. The Jumpball was A-Mazing! I highly recommend ordering this if you never have. The portion size is huge, which I always enjoy! There will def be enough that I don't have to dirty dishes for lunch today either. Honestly, I didn't eat the French Toast. I was way too full from the Jumpball and really only added it to make the $15 minimum delivery Charge.  I think I may head back to bed now. Thanks Moon for filling my tummy and starting my day off right!
Ahh this is how a diner in Chicago should look and feel. Nice staff they set up to go perfect too yelp wants more words
The older gent is the nicest guy, truly! Great prices, good food and I love that the man is always helpful and nice!

Best breakfast in Chicago as well as best corn beef.... A hidden gem. This is a 1920's sandwich shop that has managed to survive in a struggling area of Chicago. It is a very unique place that is a throwback and a true piece of history. It is not polished, it is not fancy and don't expect a great deal of "presentation". They are famous for their corned beef which is excellent, I have had it in an omelette, in a sandwich and by itself. I can say I personally am not a fan of their house specialty corned beef dinner with the brown gravy slathered on top as it is just to heavy and does not taste like a good match to me. Many people like it, I would suggest taking a pass on the gravy.  However their omelettes are excellent, I love their grits and all their breakfast type food is quite good. My favorite is a ham and cheese omelette with a side of grits. The food is honestly probably more like a 4 star overall, but the atmosphere pushes it over the edge. The short order cook there is mesmerizing to watch, I don't know how he can multitask like that and make that much that fast. If you like old school diners and sandwich shops and appreciate a good traditional breakfast, I highly suggest checking it out.

I really wanted to like this place. Its been part of the west side for over 80 years. Given the reviews and its longevity,I talked 5 of my coworkers into giving Moon's a shot. We have eaten corned beef from all over the city. Hands down this is the worst corned beef I ever had. The beef was loaded with fat,had little to no seasoning,and was relatively small in size. I wont be back and my coworkers lost confidence in my recommendations.
Good food until I ate my omelet & found a piece of aluminum inside !!! Very dissatisfied & didn't receive an apology either.

Went to Moon's for my first time today, I wasn't disappointed. The atmosphere is not unlike an old diner-dive which was very present. The staff was extremely busy but didn't rush a single customer, instead they were attentive, kind, and genuinely sweet. I ended up opting for the world famous corned beef sandwich. It was good. The meat was a little drier than what you'd get crock-potting it yourself. The bread was good, I think additional mustard, or switching to spicy brown mustard would really give this sandwich the flair it deserves. I will be back to try some other dishes and I'll update this review accordingly.

I placed an order through  grubhub.com  over 2hrs ago. Can't tell you if the food is good or not haven't received it yet!! At this point it doesn't matter what it tastes like I could've walked there by now. Nothing takes 2hrs and to further show their ineptness no 1 bothered to call. I am still trying to figure out if I will actually receive an order or not. Don't waste your time with this restaurant.
This place it terrible! If I could give it zero stars I would! I'm giving the food I ordered to the homeless only because I don't like to throw away food!

Tried the corned beef sandwich. Meat had good flavor and was tender and not watery from sitting in water like some places. The rye bread is light w/o caraway seeds. Just can't give it more stars because of the amount of meat on the sandwich. Guess I was spoiled by AP Deli from the old days.

Okay I am an authentic  Corned Beef/Pastrami FANATIC. I stopped by Moon's after hearing about it. I was a little skeptical after getting off the expressway and looking at the outside of this dirty place. I walked in and saw a lunch counter full of neighborhood low lifes hanging around and a guy sitting there selling bootleg movies, a woman sitting at the counter by the register doing bookkeeping. I walked over and ordered a corned beef on wheat with extra mustard only. I guess the cashier/owner was having a bad day cause he said a corned beef on rye with extra mayo? I said NO on wheat with extra mustard who orders a corned beef  with mayo? NOT ME EVER. Anyway I felt really uncomfortable with people coming in reaching over me, bumping into me and not saying excuse me or anything. I looked at the stringy sandwich when I got to my car and was instantly upset. Why did the sandwich have lettuce and tomato on it and rye bread and light mustard? Anyway I won't be going back and hopefully they will be closed down soon.

Not very many places are open and deliver at 6 am but moon's is.  Great.  That is about the extent of what the did well.  The food took over an hour to arrive, when pulled up he got out of his car and was looking around like he didn't know how to read addresses.  After I stepped outside and called him over he dropped off my food.  I brought it in only to discover they didn't include my drink.  Mistakes happen, not the end of the world.  Then I opened my food that turned out to be cold and lack all flavor.  They do not warrant a second chance.

I had higher hopes for this place but maybe I came on a bad day. The food has a large portion and a good price.  This place looks like your old time dinner/dive which I really like. I had their famous corned beef sandwich. It wasn't all that special. The meat tasted good though a bit dry, and the bread was good. The sandwich was over all good but I think it was missing a little something. I can't put my finger on it. I also had the Chili mac. I wasn't a fan of this. It wasn't chilli at all. No flavor - just ground beef, red beans and boiled macaroni.  They sell cookies by the register which are baked from the "Cookie Man" as they call it.

GREAT corned beef sandwich at a fair price. We dined in and the service was fast and friendly. I noticed that they have a great take out business with a constant flow of people picking up orders. We will definitely be back. I heard that the pancakes were very good also.

I have never been here, but I have had the food and I have to say is freaking amazing. They have the biggest corned beef sandwiches that I have ever seen in my life. My boyfriend has been ranting and raving about this place for years, so I decided to check them out. I got a corned beef plate, which consisted of a huge pile of tasty, well cooked corned beef (enough for two days), rye bread, salad, corn and mashed potatoes and gravy (the gravy is delish, they will put it over the entire plate, if you want). Its such a small place that if you blink you might miss it and drive past it twice. It gets very crowded very quickly and it closes early on weekdays, I believe around 2pm or 3pm, but it opens around 6am.

This place has some delicious breakfast. This particular day I had the pancakes. And I may say they are absolutely delicious. This is not a place I would dine in however, due the size, it is a very small space. But to run in and grab an order to go, it's perfect. The price is pretty cheap as well.  By the way, if you should find yourself here after breakfast time, they have the best corned beef dinner around. You can't go wrong. I don't think they're open too much past lunch time.

The interior of this place is greasy greasy but their corned beef sandwiches are delicious. Giant corned beef sandwich for a decent price, oh yeah!  The only complain I have is that the sandwiches lack condiments and salt. They need more mustards and pickles. The corned beef was under-salted for my taste. Overall, my sandwich was great and I ate that thing in 30 seconds.
Delicious corned beef at a decent price. They dealt with the lunch rush well through copious staffing.

Good food (we grabbed cornbeef to go), didn't blow our minds but a good amount of food and the meat quality/cut and pickle were good.  My wife said the interior was like "a dinner...but not in a good way...). Probably wont go again, but met the need for a fast meal.
The pancakes. I am addicted. I would eat them every day if I could! If you enjoy vintage diners this place is a gem. Always bustling, friendly service and generous portions for the price.

There's not much happening food-wise in this part of the city, so we were so excited to see this place with such high ratings and such rave reviews.  Had to try it. I have to say, there was a bit of culture shock for us North Siders coming in for late lunch at 2:30 pm.  Definitely the kind of greasy spoon place we don't have in the 'burbs, and the atmosphere was friendly but we still felt a little out of place.  Next time we'd know more to expect... But still wouldn't fit in with the locals hanging out here just yet! I got the tuna salad on wheat with lettuce and tomato, which was the only thing on the menu apart from the grilled cheese that a vegetarian-leaning pescatarian could order.  It was tasty, and they were super generous with the tuna-scooping!  It was well-made tuna salad, too.  But sparse on the veggies, as is the case with the menu in general. My mom got the famed corned beef and thought it was good, but maybe a little stringy.  But we were both truly amazed at the value of the meals here, paying about $12 for both of our sandwiches! Now that's some West Side culture we could get used to!

BEWARE!! Do not come here If you are on YOUR lunch break!! The food here is just so ridiculously outstandingly scrumdidiliociously delicious that it will make you not go back to work and straight to the back seat of your car or office for an immediate violent nap!!! I took 3 of my coworkers here and we had a beautiful yawing symphony on the drive back to work. So there I was! We walked in and instantly I fell in love with the place. The inside is just perfect. It's small, limited and only counter seating with so much movement going on. The place is packed and all you hear is "Give 2 Rye 1 White!!!". I counted at least 9 employees and who knows how many more they have in the back. Corned Beef is just constantly being sliced in front of you to fill their endless orders. When we sat down the waitress was just so nice and happy. She was one of those that could brighten up your mood and get along with anyone. We placed out order and then the owner came by because we were in uniform and went up to our biggest guy and said "You're a big fella, lets arm wrestle".  We all have the Famous Moon Corned Beef sandwich and it was so delicious. There was a behemoth mound of corned beef in between the buns!!! It was very fresh, rich and moist. It was far from dry (I hate those). The rye bread was not over powering in taste and soft as well. I also had a side of hashbrowns with my sandwich. They potatoes hit the spot! This all hit the spot! I was giggling like a little school girl. Extremely filling and very inexpensive. Food and Service was A++ I will definitely go back there and try the Jumpball! It was so mouthwatering but I could not do it. Door wasn't wide enough for me to get on the ground and roll back to my car.

Alright, honestly, I have been eating Corned Beef sandwiches ever since I had my first tooth, and probably before that while nursing on old momma, and damn man, this sandwich was just plain great. Not only was the Corned Beef perfectly salty and seasoned, but the bread and the SIZE were extraordinary. You can easily stuff your face for $8.00 on the sandwich alone, and walk away 100% satisfied. On top of that, the place itself is charming and friendly. The staff was cool, the patrons were cuttin' it up, and the music was humming. I really don't understand now why it took me so long to hit this place up. Me and the family will definitely be coming back here quite often, as it's never a bad idea to chow down on good food at cheap prices.  BTW, here are some tips... 1. It can get busy, and the seating is counter only, and few at that. 2. Carryout is a good move. 3. They take Visa I am sure of, not so sure about MC. 4. You CANNOT TIP ON C.C.!! Bring cash foolio... 5. There is ample street parking just north of the storefront. Then go right.. 6. Don't dilly-dally as the place is fast paced. Make up your mind and move... Enjoy Suckas'!!!

Overrated!!  Inside, it's a really busy diner that's probably never been updated since the 40's with a mixed bag of diners and lots of regulars.  We all got sandwiches and everyone came to the same conclusion:: Great Corned Beef and Roast Beef but the rest of Condiments on sandwich really ruined it!  Cheap Mustard that tastes like that crap from Aldi and crappy lettuce & tomato?  Bread was very marginal and the price for a Roast Beef Sandwich and a can of RC is $8.50?  Not a pickle or a chip included!  I would go back and try their breakfast cause I know something has to be good here... GTFJD

The atmosphere is great (old school) and the food is good.  The people that work here have a real personality- not a fake smile and fake customer service.  Coffee is good too.  All around great place for some entertainment, news, food, and conversation.

The food amazing- the place crowded, please call in your orders or have them delivered because if you walk in thinking your going to walk back out wrong! They attract a huge breakfast lunch crowd because the food is good. I cannot wait til our bacon and eggs run out at home so I can say babe I'm hungry and we have no breakfast food lets order Moons:)
Good Stuff!

For breakfast: pretty good! The 20 stops right by and you walk right across the street. The entire staff was extremely friendly and service was very fast. Also, pancakes and french toast were delicious. Eggs were cooked just as I asked--nothing unexpected. Definitely going back for the corned beef.

Our new breakfast spot, indeed, and only two blocks from home!  Plus they're on GrubHub so you can order for pick up or delivery.  If you're going by on Western, you'll totally miss it as it's so non-descript. I dig the pancakes (especially since you can get 2 or 3 to an order, not waste food ((finally)) or chow down), the french toast my sweetheart got was really good, he gets eggs, potatoes, and lots of other stuff.  And cheap too, wow!  It's a small old school diner-type place with the melamine plates and plastic cups, counter seating only.  Folks behind the counter were friendly and food was hot, fresh and fast. We took some of the dinners home to go for later, and mmm, I think we're going to stick to breakfast.  They weren't bad, just not great.  You get 1000 lbs of food, enough for at least 2-3 people per order.  He got the corned beef dinner and wasn't fond.  I had the turkey dinner which was deli sliced turkey tossed on the flattop.  The mashed potatoes were a boxed mix, sadly. They do take credit cards and there seems to be some confusion between various websites about their hours.  All I know is they open crazy early and close sometime in the afternoon.   Either way, we will be back for breakfast for sure.

If you like Moon's, you'll love catching a glimpse of what goes into the classic sandwich shop.  A free local film fest on the Near West Side of Chicago is showing a short documentary about Moon's this Thursday, July 12 at 8pm.  I know this isn't exactly a review but I've heard a lot of great things about they're corned beef and just wanted to give fans a heads up!  For more info and to  check out some sweet flyers, use these links and check out the free event (It's called K-Town at Sundown) sponsored by Facets Multimedia, Better Boys Foundation and IZZE Juice: facets.org/sundown/progr…   facebook.com/facetsmovies facebook.com/Better.Boys…

I mean, the corned beef sandwich was pretty good, but it's just too greasy for my liking, but I think that's just how it's supposed to be, so I can't really blame them for that. The place didn't seem very clean either, and my take out wasn't ready even though I got there 20 mins late, and it wasn't busy.I also got the soup which wasn't good at all. I probably wouldn't come back here again.

I just gotta say I love me some moons.  If you live or were raised on the west side and you don't know about Moons you have failed!  You hear me?  FAILED! Moons was a part of my childhood.  When I crave corned beef it should be assumed that I'm craving Moon's.  It's flat out the best sandwich shop on the west side if not the entire city.  I know that's a huge claim but I am a little biased.  I was raised on the stuff.   Their sandwiches are huge!  Packed with meet and so satisfying.  Every one who works there is wonderful and knows how to make a sandwich.  Seriously folks I can't say enough about this place.  Please go and try it yourself.  You won't be disappointed!
Great corned beef, no BS to deal with.  The atmosphere was coo too!

Firstly I will say that Chicago is not a pastrami or corn beef town. If you think it is, you are wrong. If you think that any shop or deli in Chicago sells blow-your-freakin-mind-omg-so-so-so-good-best-thing-ever Jewish fare, you are also wrong.  However, Moon's comes awfully close when it comes to corn beef. Having been to the famous NYC delis, I have tasted what is probably the pinnacle of Jewish fare in the states (or at least accessible Jewish fare; maybe there's some unknown amazing place in Nowhere-ville). I have been to Moon's twice, and both times their corn beef sandwich has been consistently moist and delicious. It doesn't blow my mind, but definitely concussion-oh-wtf-just-happened-oh-yummy-sandwich good.  Yes, I have been to Manny's. Yes, this is better than Manny's, much much better. Yes, I have been to Manny's more than once and I still think Moon's is better.  I think my fellow Yelpers and foodies should be aware of a few things before they go out and hunt down Moon's: 1. A corn beef sandwich is $8 and change after tax. I am cheap and eat a lot, and I still think it is sizable and well worth the money. 2. The area is not the best. Honestly, it's pretty ghetto. The prices probably reflect that. But I went there and I am still alive, and I never once feared for my life, or my sandwich. 3. Ample parking around the shop.

Where did I go wrong?!?  Moon's is nearly a 5 star joint, according to Yelp...so what's my deal huh?   I ordered vegetable soup and a turkey sandwich while the hubby got a burger and chili.  The soups looked gross, especially the chili...it tasted even grosser.  It was like blended baby food with no resemblance to chili at all.  His burger was a basic burger just a step above McD's.  My turkey sandwich was pretty good, there was a hearty portion of meat in there, but my taste buds were so put off by that my soup (and the hubby's) they didn't care.   We took our food to go.  The restaurant is a little bit of a dirty spoon joint.  I wouldn't be surprised if there were some health code violations going on in there.  A small, greasy diner style...but worse.  I couldn't decide if it needed a good cleaning or just a straight up face lift...probably both.  For nearly $20 I would have expected more. I've decided if I ever decided to go back, I will only be ordering a corn beef sandwich...it seems that's what's where the 5 stars comes from.

went "over the moon"  with my shaved corned beef sandwich  tender meat goodness  For some odd reason, perhaps the lack of Jews, the deeper one goes into the Midwest, usually, the worse the corned beef is. Not an issue at this wonderful little spot. Moon's has been around a long time, and looks it. A bit worn -like me.   Granted, its not Katz's Deli in NYC or Slymans or Mister Brisket in Cleveland, but damn! I'll eat this every time! Shaved thin, a bit on the lean side and packed with enough corned beef for 2 sandwiches. Awesome pickles too! Definitely worth the trip and the mustard stains.  Carry on.

This made the Chicago's best list in the Reader a few years ago. It mentioned the characters who frequent and work here. They said it added to the charm. It does. I love this place! They have in house made corned beef, grits with tons of butter, and the lightest, fluffiest, most tasty pancakes that I've ever had. Seriously. I think so highly of this place that I requested a Moon's breakfast for my birthday. I've even taken out of towners here so they can get a taste of some true city scenery plus 1 of the best breakfasts they'll ever have. Also yes they do now take credit cards and have lengthened their hours a bit. I wish they'd be open later but seeing as the same staff seems to be there every time I go I understand the short hours. This is place is one of a kind and one of the best diners period.

We ate at Moon's for breakfast two days in a row on a three-day trip to Chicago. The first morning, we shared a Jumpball, some grits, and a pancake. I thought the grits were pretty standard, the pancake was great (not too spongy, not too cakey, just enough butter) and the Jumpball was heaven on earth. It's a concoction of eggs, cheese, onions, and their fried potatoes -- crispy in some places, mushy and gooey in others, perfectly balanced. The second day I ordered my own Jumpball and had enough leftovers for breakfast on Day 3.  Moon's will become a must on every future trip to Chicago!  Some FYIs: They do take credit cards, just make sure to have them add in your tip before they run it. There is counter seating only and they do a ton of take-out and delivery business, although I think I'd rather eat it hot and in the company of the friendly staff.

Just stopped in for lunch because I heard about their corned beef. Only one word can describe it, AWESOME. That was some of the best corned beef I've had, and yes I've been to Manny's. The meat was soft, juicy and tender. I got it on an onion role with the works and I would definitely suggest the same.

Wow!!!  Friends told me it was best I the country.  It is.  Had the roast beef and it is a five star plus.  Do not get scared by the exteror or the guy selling cd's and deodorant table to table.  The staff and patrons were nice and welcoming to the white professional lady in a skirt and heels and everyone else.
Absolutely wonderful, and in my neighborhood.  Love love love love love the fried potatoes.  Cheeseburger was delicious!  Can't wait to go back and give breakfast a try!

The food is incredible, the service impeccable, and the atmosphere puts even an awkward white kid from the 'burbs like me completely at ease.   They're on Grubhub, but do yourself a favor and stop in for breakfast.  The entire kitchen will be sizzling with comfort foods cooked to perfection, the staff laughing away behind the counter and the good vibes radiating throughout.

Good lord.  Moon's, where have you been all my life?  I hardly even know what to say, as my Moon's experience was so whirlwind, but woah.  I made a quick takeout call, entered a whirling, grease scented vortex, and ended up back in my car with a corned beef sandwich and pickles in hand, wallet about $7 lighter.   And what a sandwich.  Delicious.  Cheaper and smaller (and this isn't a criticism by any means) than Manny's and just as delicious.  The generous side of pickles (as requested) was also spot on.  SALT BOMB! Just a note, even though the Yelp listing says no credit, the signs in the restaurant say otherwise.

my friend and i were craving breakfast food and scouting places that delivered to her building....courtesy of  grubhub.com  we found this gem. super cheap breakfast options and it was really good. we both ordered the moon's breakfast (3 pancakes, 2 eggs, bacon/ham/sausage). the pancakes were nice and fluffy with a slight buttery taste to them, the bacon was perfection, and i always love me some overeasy eggs. =) the food definitely hit the spot. it took awhile for it to get delivered though...1.5 hrs, when we were originally told 1 hr. however, it was worth the wait!

Moon's is a wonderful hidden gem in the city:) First of all,Driving down western you wouldn't never notice moon's sandwich shop because it's so tiny but lucky for me  I did notice and it's in walking distance.I love everything about this place.the atmosphere is more mature,but the energy of the place felt young. The staff is very friendly I felt like I was talking to good friends. The food was incredible and the portion were huge. Because of moons I'm starting to think about other little hidden gems in  this huge city of ours!! Did someone say food project?!?
Great food, and a fun atmosphere to eat your breakfast or lunch.  Everybody's welcome here.  Obviously the corned beef gets mentioned a lot, but everything else is good as well.
Yeah. It's a good place. See the reviews on WTTW's Check Please. It would be nice if they had regular coffee cups instead of styrofoam.

Best corned beef in Chicago!  The ladies are so nice and the atmosphere is really laid-back and nice.  I love that they served fresh fruit with the meal.  I like butter and cheese with my corned beef and they looked at me funny, but they still served it to me with a smile.  Best ever!

Moon's has been around for  a while, yet I am just writing a reivew. I absolutely LOVE their corned beef dinner.  My only complaint, they close so early. The neighborhood is changing, but I would close before dark also. However, they close before 5 pm, so, no Moon's for dinner.  I will agree with my fellow Yelpers about the decor or apperarance of the shop. But deeeelicious and worth it.
You can't get any better than Moon's! The entire menu is amazing! Corn Beef Dinner is the BEST!

Outstanding place. Old building that looks as though it found a groove in the 1940's and just figured it would stay that way. Went with a group from work and the food was great. The staff were very friendly (eager to share storied of their history in the neighborhood to a group of teachers). For as much food as we ordered the bill was much less than your typical Chicago diner.

Agree with everyone else on the list.  I have been twice and the corned beef sandwich is a 10.  Think Manny's for half price.  The reason it is half price is the location.  It does look like an abandoned building and not my typical socio-economic group.  Having said that everyone I spoke with and met was nothing but nice and happy to have the business. I did take out and will be everytime I head down to the stadium

I stopped by here the other day after I heard they had a good corned beef sandwich.  I had heard correctly.    I'll start by saying that my rating is based on the food alone.  If you pass by the building you will probably assume that is abandoned. And no, I am not joking, the place is a certifiable dump.   Don't let that discourage you though. Anyways, the sandwich was huge, the corned beef was really really tender and flavorful and the fries were very tasty also.  Prices were decent, I think my sandwich combo was around $8 and it was one of the most expensive on the menu.  The folks that worked there were definitely interesting, I'm sure the place has some stories.   Anyway, if you want a solid sandwich I would recommend picking up from here, it was damn good and not something you find everyday.

If I gain 50 lbs this summer, I'm blaming Moon's. This is one of those places that time has forgotten but, thankfully, its legion of fans have not.  I've been thinking about Moon's a lot lately as I'm often working in the condo building next door and am frequently asked about "that hole in the wall" by the clients. Before my poor, unsuspecting buyers know what has hit them, they are subjected to Jenny's patented "Don't judge a book by it's cover" restaurant lecture.   Don't make me give  you the same lecture (I don't care WHAT it looks like, corned beef second only to Manny's and a heckuvalot cheaper, open since the 1930's, grits and eggs, salami omelets, chili-mac, depression style burgers, great mashed potatoes and meatloaf, silly nice staff, fried salami sandwiches, cheap, cheap, cheap and delicious, off the menu sides of corned beef available with breakfast, recipient of an LTH GNR award, it's a cop hangout, so you know the food is great, an ungodly delicious breakfast concoction called the jumpball, corned beef available with GRAVY), just get over there, slide up to the counter, and see for yourself. Oh yeah, bonus points as the name "Moon's" supposedly derives from certain activities during prohibition.  Seriously, it doesn't get much better than this.   Did I mention the corned beef?

From the outside, this place looks like a rundown shack... but every time I drive by it, there is a line of people going in and out.... which made me wonder... "Hmmm... is this one of those hole in the walls that have ridiculously good food?" I'm happy to say, that at least this was partially true. As an pre-dominately Asian crowd post Illini game, we entered and definitely wondered how we would be welcomed.  And suprisingly, we were welcomed with open arms... Sat down at the bar, ordered up a meatloaf sandwich, and chatted it up with the regulars.  The place has been open for over 60 years serving up good food at VERY reasonable prices.  Ownership has changed multiple times, but the regulars told me the food quality to price ratio has stayed consistent. Ultimately, the meatloaf sandwich was a whopping $5 and tasty.  The corned beef, while $7, was ridiculously large and a much better deal for the price... According to my roommate - "A good solid pork chop sandwich" as well. One of the key things that I remember is the customer service.  Not only were all the servers genuinly happy and excited to be there, they fully enjoyed seeing their old customers come back in to visit them.  In fact, the meatloaf sandwich came out to $5.09.  As I was grasping for change, the server just said "Don't worry about it... what's nine cents, right?"   Ultimately, affordable food, good quality, friendly people, and a landmark that has been around for decades.  Great service that is focused on the customer, and definitely a place that my roommates and I plan to visit again in the future. Corned beef?  Not quite as good as Manny's Deli in my humble opinion... but also significantly cheaper and delicious. Take a visit!  You'll be pleasantly surprised...

AP Deli has nothing on Moon's Corned Beef platter- which includes mashed potatoes w/ gravy, corn, and bread. The outside of the restaurant is kinda shabby, but like the old saying goes 'looks isn't everything' which definitely speaks well about this place. This place closes at 3pm...what a shame it doesn't say open longer.

I always thought this place was abandoned until one day, the new field manager brought me a breakfast sandwich. I bit into heaven masquerading as an egg, ham, and cheese union of near holy excellent and became a convert.  This is definitely a take-out place as there is standing room only and the orders are turned out as quickly as they come in.  Everything is good, but if you insist on a recommendation, I'd say get one of each.

I try to go here before any United Center event I attend. The food is awesome and in big portions. Meatloaf sandwich, rib tip sandwich, corned beef sandwich, you get the gist. The grits are awesome too (I don't even like grits- this is the only place I eat them at) I've never gone without being the only white person in there, but it makes no difference to me or them, so don't be afraid to stop by before a Bulls game. A little bit dingy, so not really a place to stop by with your whole family. Seems like a lot of people do takeout though. Place closes at 3.

You may have seen this place plenty of times out of the corner of your eye as you headed past the corner of Western & Madison on your way to the cool hangs up the road on Western or in Ukie Village. Don't be put off by the 'hood as you will miss out on some of the best classic diner food in Chicago. Great corned beef sandwiches, burgers, eggs and grits made by a fry cook who deserves the Spongebob golden spatula award. Wait staff is friendly and will be happy to tell you what and how to order.
